snippet: Parents of children at Public School 85 want the Education Department and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to fix what they say is an obstacle to learning.
abstract: Parents of children at Public School 85 in Astoria, Queens, want New York City Department of Education and Metropolitan Transportation Authority to address noise from elevated N and Q train track dozens of feet outside classroom windows; they say noise, which has been measured many times higher than recommended decibel levels, is obstacle to learning.
lead_paragraph: Parents of children at Public School 85 want the Education Department and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to fix what they say is an obstacle to learning.

headline.main: Parents Push to Quiet Roar From Trains Near Queens School
headline.print_headline: Parents Push To Quiet Roar From Trains Near School
